intro: Guapira venosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf guapira, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically producing yellow or white petals. Guapira venosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
